moves.1. e4: The master sticks to standard lines.
moves.2. Nf3: The usual move nowadays. 2 B-B4 was standard until the middle of the 19th century.
moves.2... Qf6: What the...? That's why he's an amateur. This is the worst possible way to defend the pawn. I'd play 2... P-KB3 before resorting to this.
moves.3... Bc5: If Black had played any other 2nd move, he could now follow up with 4... N-KB3 and prepare to castle into safety.
moves.4... d6: Why wasn't this played on move 2?
moves.5. d3: Opening a line for the QB to now come out.
moves.5... Ne7: Unnatural, but because of the second move there is no good square.
moves.7. Bg5: ...with disastrous results. The Queen is trapped and Black resigns immediately.
